verb.description: (of a police officer or other official) pass the hands over (someone) in a search for hidden weapons, drugs, or other items.
(of an animal or person) skip or leap playfully; frolic.
examples: this did not deter the foal from frisking about

origin: Early 16th century (in frisk (sense 2 of the noun)): from obsolete frisk lively, frisky, from Old French frisque alert, lively, merry, perhaps of Germanic origin. frisk (sense 1 of the noun), originally a slang term, dates from the late 18th century.
